poll_list.title: Undertake Necessary Risk and Legal Assessments to Increase the NS-DROP Debt Ceiling to 50 Million DAI - November 28, 2022

discourse_list.title: [Request to Poll] Poll to move forward with the commercial risk, legal, and other work necessary to increase the NS-DROP DC to 50M DAI

content.content: New Silver has requested an increase in the debt ceiling of the NS-DROP vault with the below parameters. If MKR holders are in support, SF will facilitate a commercial risk as well as a legal assessment, if deemed necessary, to evaluate the proposed parameters.  Adding in WSFS as the trustee, based on the Trust Indenture  put together earlier this year by Christian Petersen and Eli Cohen. Increase vault debt ceiling to 50mm DAI Remove senior co-investor requirement and over collateralization requirement Increase Junior minimum to 20% from 15% Increase stability fee to 4.5% from 3.5%  Additional information below:  Proposed Term Sheet  Company financials, actuals and projections  Trust indenture agreement  Current portfolio overview  Detailed terms and company information
content.GPT-summary: New Silver is proposing an increase in the debt ceiling of the NS-DROP vault and has provided details of the proposed parameters. They are requesting feedback from MKR holders and if approved, a commercial risk and legal assessment will be conducted. The proposal includes an increase in the Junior minimum, stability fee, and removal of senior co-investor and over-collateralization requirements. The post also provides additional information such as a proposed term sheet, company financials, and portfolio overview.
GPT-discussion-categories: Author of proposal is explaining proposal

content.content: To clarify, is this Genesis Trading the same as the one that has been under speculation for bankruptcy?  If it is the same entity, is it something the community should be concerned about?

Genesis has communicated that Genesis Global Trading is fully segregated from the Genesis Lending business and is independently capitalized and operated. They continue to operate as usual and are not impacted by the lending market stress.
GPT-discussion-categories: None of the topics listed match.

content.content: Aes:  Genesis has communicated that Genesis Global Trading is fully segregated from the Genesis Lending business and is independently capitalized and operated.   Is there a reliable third party like audit that can confirm it? Considering we had many in the industry that communicated such but turned out to be not true ranging from FTX to Blockfi, I think it’s good for the community to be extra careful. But what happens if they do go under? The deal will find a different conversion agent?

Yes, we have been in touch with Genesis and heard the same feedback. While Genesis has been successfully used as a counterparty by RWA previously, we will undertake an effort to have a backup option with a counterparty of similar scale.
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving constructive criticism of proposal

content.content: I wanted to thank everyone for their support and partnership in helping New Silver pass the governance poll with 99.83% in favor. Thank you @Aes for helping move this forward, and thanks to @Recognized-Delegates and the Community for your continued support. We are ready to take the next step forward!
GPT-discussion-categories: 3rd party giving entirely positive feedback on proposal

content.content: This topic was automatically closed 91 days after the last reply. New replies are no longer allowed.
